stories.title: Nevada Caucuses: Live Updates
stories.description: Join us for live coverage and analysis of the Republican Nevada caucuses.
stories.author: The New York Times

stories.title: Nevada Caucuses: Live Updates
stories.description: Maggie Haberman, Nick Confessore, Nate Cohn and Alan Rappeport are providing context and analysis on the Nevada caucuses in the Republican race. More Times contributors are on the ground in the state.
stories.author: The New York Times

stories.title: Philip Knight of Nike to Give $400 Million to Stanford Scholars
stories.description: The gift from Philip H. Knight, a co-founder of Nike, will make the new Knight-Hennessy program one of the largest fully funded scholarship endowments in the world.
stories.author: Alessandra Stanley

stories.title: Nevada Caucuses: Live Updates
stories.description: Donald J. Trump was declared the winner of the Nevada caucuses on Tuesday night, according to The Associated Press.
stories.author: The New York Times

stories.title: Donald Trump Wins Nevada Caucuses, Collecting Third Straight Victory
stories.description: Mr. Trump was seen as the favorite going into the contest, but his victory still added pressure on his rivals as the Super Tuesday elections approach.
stories.author: Alexander Burns and Nick Corasaniti

stories.title: Republican Nevada Caucuses: Highlights
stories.description: Donald J. Trump was declared the winner of the Nevada G.O.P. caucuses on Tuesday night, according to The Associated Press.
stories.author: The New York Times

stories.title: Donald Trump Wins Nevada Caucuses, Collecting Third Straight Victory
stories.description: Mr. Trump was seen as the favorite going into the contest, but his victory still added pressure on his rivals as the Super Tuesday elections approach.
stories.author: Alexander Burns and Nick Corasaniti

stories.title: Snapshots From the Primary Campaign Trail - Election 2016
stories.description: The days before Super Tuesday are intense — and often emotional — for voters and candidates alike. A small army of Times reporters, photographers and video journalists is on assignment following the campaigns to capture that drama.
